review: Home Wi-Fi saw the device but could not activate it using Windows 8.1.  Looked on the internet and saw many, many recommendations to change my router settings.  Tried them all to no avail.  Purely by accident I had to boot up my Windows 7 laptop for retrieve some forgotten files.  The device immediately was recognized and began to update itself.  Same device same home network.  Only difference was operating system.  Windows 7 versus Windows 8.1.  After the device updated itself I then booted my Windows 8,1 system and voila there is was.  Google really should find a better way to do updates than via it's own device unless they make it OS neutral.

review: Although limited in the content you can stream, this is a handy solution to deliver content like Netflix.  I used this on TV's around the house that didn't have a smart receiver attached.  By setting up the device once, I am able to move it throughout the house and control it with my phone/laptop/tablet with ease.  I can even control the volume remotely.5 stars!!!

review: This might have been a great product, however Google made a mistake they valued the wrong clients over the customers who would be using this product.  This product does not product an HD picture its 720, so Strike one, This product requires an internet connection to work, (if you have anything less than super high broad band sadly, you will not appreciate this product at all)I really wanted to be able to easily display our own video without attempting to use the internet to upload then download to our TV.Strike Two...This product was neutered, because of corporate interests in DRM technology, they are so worried that someone might stream a movie that did not come from a paid subscription service, IE, they want you to become a customer of a paid subscription service, so were devalued as a consumer.Strike Three.When Digital Rights trump the consumers right to use the products they buy this is the last straw, This is like buying a blender and then having someone say sorry, but you cannot use that blender to make a strawberry smoothie, because someone owns the patent on making strawberry smoothies So sorry but you cant your the product you purchased to do what you want to do without us giving you an authorization to do so.All I wanted to be able to do was to stream a video from my iPad directly to the TV we do not have fast internet in fact we cant even watch a youtube video, without it breaking up.So, we needed a solution which would allow us to use a device to directly stream the content to the TV, but Google values its corporate masters over the end user.I am sick of this corporate greed and cheap valueless products that are advertised on TV as if they are the latest great thing.This is the worst product I have ever seen its just garbage and trash.
